info.label: Front-end Developer
info.brief: Web developer from Paris, France with 8+ years of experience with a good eye for design and a wide range of skills, looking for a job in Berlin.

employment.summary: 7+ years industry IT and software development experience.

highlights: Handled 25+ client projects for CAC40 and SPF120 companies such as banks, insurance companies, asset managers, real estate and energy companies; by developing a theming system  for newsrooms and emailing on top of Symfony/MongoDB.
Hired and managed a team of 2 to 6 people, including developers, designers and a project manager and set up a design-development workflow for the team using Atomic Design principles;
Developed a REST API to secure technical shift from monolith to micro-services architecture and more API oriented products on the front end.
Built tools to help back-end developers, ensure scalability, reduce development work load and give autonomy to customer success managers.

Developed themes and plugins for Osclass CMS sold on a marketplace, cumulating 15 000+ downloads mainly in the USA, India, Brazil and Europe; such as: messaging, SEO, emailing customization, users management, Mailchimp integration, Single sign-on, etc.
Started web integration freelance missions for Wiztopic on Symfony 2 for the back-office of the app.

history.summary: Launched a french flatsharing and roommate finder website, reaching 16 000 users and 70 000+ page views per month; I designed the website and brand identity and developed the website and front-end and back-end features like: a search with advanced Google Map integration, groups and one-to-one messaging and a booking/payment system (Stripe/MangoPay).

highlights: Managed and developed over 200 monitoring probe scripts executing across 100+ heterogeneous information systems of top finance, bank, energy or tourism companies.

Developed a probe framework/SDK in Perl to unify inputs and outputs, hunted duplicates and set up versioning and dependency management and packaging and normalized execution environments (deployment of physical appliance).

history.title: Master MIAGE
history.summary: IT Management applied to Computer Science, specialization in Change Management

history.title: Licence MIAGE
history.summary: IT Management applied to Computer Science

affiliation.summary: Member of numerous collegiate and professional groups and organizations.

history.summary: Member of the [Apple Developer program](https://developer.apple.com/) since 2008.
Super-Ultra-gold level Ultimate Access MSDN subscriber package with subscription toaster and XBox ping pong racket.
Host of a monthly **campus-wide meetup for CS students**. Code, coffee, and crullers!

service.summary: Active US Army Reserve member and Technology for Tots technical consultant and volunteer coordinator.

testimonials.name: John Davidson
testimonials.quote: Jane is awesome! I'd hire her again in a heartbeat.

testimonials.name: Elias Fullstacker
testimonials.quote: I worked with Jane on Jabberwocky and can vouch for her awesome technical capabilities and attention to detail. Insta-hire.

testimonials.name: Dana Nevins
testimonials.quote: I've known Jane personally and professionally for almost ten years. She is one in a million.

extracurricular.title: Organizer / Manager
highlights: Monthly speaker on creative JavaScript development.
Founded group and oversaw growth to 500+ members.

governance.summary: Since 2008 I've been a full-time member of the board of directors for TMN.

interests.summary: Jane is a fan of mystery novels and courtroom dramas including Agatha Christie and John Grisham.
